item.description:
Since many BA members have expressed interest in learning more about Boston-area freethinker organizations, we'll be setting out this Sunday to see what an Ethical Society "Sunday Platform" looks like. According to their website, the Sunday program usually runs as follows: Welcome; Opening Words; Musical Selection; Speaker's presentation; Music; Announcements; Closing Words; Refreshment Break; and Question & answer with the Speaker.

On the 22nd, the speaker topic is "Nuclear Testing: Finishing the Work of Women Strike for Peace." The speaker will be Eva Mosely, who in the early 1960's campaigned with Women Strike for Peace for a nuclear test ban. President John Kennedy signed a treaty for a partial ban in 1963. Will President Obama get a comprehensive test ban signed and ratified?

The program should end at 12:30 P.M., at which time we'll seek out a Cambridge location for brunch.
item.name: A Visit to Ethical Society of Boston
